knimeNode.name: Workflow Writer
knimeNode.shortDescription: Writes a workflow from a port object into a directory or an exported KNIME workflow (.knwf) archive.

fullDescription.intro: Writes a workflow from a port object into a directory or an exported KNIME workflow (.knwf) archive.

tab.name: Options
tab.option:
Select a file system to write to. There are three default file system options to choose from:
Local File System: Allows you to select a directory from your local system.
Mountpoint: Allows you to choose a mountpoint. Whenever this is selected, a new drop-down menu appears to choose from available mountpoints.
Relative to: Allows you to choose whether to resolve the path relative to the workflow or mountpoint.
It is possible to use other file systems with this node. To this end, you have to enable the file system connection input port of this node by clicking the ... in the bottom left corner of the node's icon and choose Add File System Connection port. Afterwards, you can connect the desired connector node to the Workflow Writer node. The file system connection will then be shown in the drop down menu.

Enter a valid path pointing to a folder / workflow group.
You can also choose a previously selected folder from the drop-down list, or select a destination from the "Browse..." dialog.
If checked, any parents of the destination folder that do not exist yet are created.
Choose the behavior that shall be followed when a workflow already exists at the configured location. Valid options are to fail on execution or to overwrite the existing workflow.
If the workflow should be written as .knwf archive instead of a directory.

option.name: Refresh explorer and open after write

tab.option: Determines whether the KNIME Explorer should be refreshed and the workflow should be opened in KNIME Analytics Platform after it has been written.
If checked, a custom workflow name is used as specified below. Otherwise the default workflow name, as shown above, is used.
A customizable name for the to-be-written workflow.

tab.name: Inputs & Outputs
tab.option: Allows one to add input nodes connected to selected inputs prior writing. Depending on the selected node here is a limited set of options available to pre-configure the node to be added. Furthermore, if tabular input data is stored with the input, it is used as examples input data for added input nodes.
Allows one to add output nodes connected to selected inputs prior writing. Depending on the selected node there is a limited set of options available to pre-configure the node to be added.
